run_metadata.article_title: Europe must not appease Trump on Greenland
run_metadata.article_hypothesis: US-Europe conflict risks tariffs and alliance breakdown

ideas.why: Escalating US–EU tariffs would invite European retaliation on US tech. Apple has high Europe revenue exposure, making it vulnerable to near-term sentiment and trade-friction driven multiple compression, assuming tariffs move beyond rhetoric.
European counter-tariffs explicitly targeting big US tech would directly hit Microsoft’s enterprise and cloud footprint in Europe, assuming the EU follows through on broad-based tech retaliation.
A visible fracture in NATO and rising Arctic security tensions could accelerate European defense spending, benefiting prime US contractors like Lockheed if security fears outweigh trade retaliation.
US tech firms aligned with Trump’s political ecosystem are named as potential EU tariff targets, making Meta vulnerable to regulatory and trade-driven sentiment shocks if confrontation escalates.

key_assumptions: Trump proceeds with Greenland-related tariffs rather than backing down
EU responds with targeted counter-tariffs instead of symbolic measures
Trade conflict meaningfully impacts near-term market sentiment
Security tensions do not rapidly de-escalate
